rules.prover9_expression: (verified_form(security, form1) -> (submitted_form(employee, form1) -> (approved_by(employee, director) | (approved_by(employee, supervisor) | approved_by(employee, manager)))))
rules.natural: Provided that security verified form 1, then if the employee submitted form 1, it follows that either the employee is approved by the director, or the employee is approved by the supervisor, or the employee is approved by the manager.
Either the guard checks the vehicle or the agent checks the vehicle.
Whenever the agent checks the vehicle, then if the employee does not have a valid clearance, it is not the case that the employee is authorized to enter the building.
Provided that the guard issues a pass to the employee, then the guard grants access to the employee.

Whenever the employee completes the course, then the employee receives a certificate.

If security confirms the clearance of the employee, then the supervisor confirms the clearance of the employee.

If the employee uses the scanner, then if the employee does not have a valid clearance, the employee has clearance at level 1.

Under the condition that the investigator conducts an interview with the employee, then if it is not the case that lacking a valid clearance implies the employee enters the restricted area, then the employee does not report the loss of the device.
Either the employee violates the policy, or the employee uses tool 1, or the employee uses tool 2.

Whenever the system flags a violation by the employee, then the employee does not violate the policy.

If the employee violates the procedure, then the employee does not follow the procedure.

(A55 ∨ (A26 ∨ A27)).natural: Either the employee violates the policy, or the employee uses tool 1, or the employee uses tool 2.

(A56 → A57).natural: Whenever security monitors the system network, then the system detects an anomaly in the activity.

(A6 → ¬A7).natural: If the employee violates the procedure, then the employee does not follow the procedure.
